titles.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1101 Colorado Street in Boulder City, Nevada, as the "Bruce Woodbury Post Office Building".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Mr. Carter moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2254.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 369 - 0 (Roll no. 276).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Collins without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 338.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 11/11/2003--Public Law. Designates the U.S. Postal Service facility located at 1101 Colorado Street in Boulder City, Nevada, as the Bruce Woodbury Post Office Building.
